stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Course 14, tweaking layout, enemies, and planning its 8-bit/retro subsection. He finalizes UV-mapped geometry to hand off to Biobak, debates design options (rollable bridge, spikes, retro game theme), and sketches the logic for a Mario Paint-inspired drawing minigame. He also reviews overall project progress and course re-works.

development_findings.summary: Finished UV-mapping the new Course 14 interior area; increased its size to improve camera behavior and removed a ground-pound/triple-jump skip.
development_findings.quote: The area needed to be bigger for the sake of the camera.

development_findings.summary: Will send the grey-boxed Course 14 geometry to Biobak for final texturing and color work.
development_findings.quote: This is what we're gonna send off to Biobak—he's gonna make the colors pretty.

development_findings.summary: Introduced a new pencil-shaving enemy (‘Bump’/‘Cut Bump’) and is play-testing its push-back behavior.
development_findings.quote: What do you guys think of the bump? He'll of course be a little more visible once the colors are in.

development_findings.summary: Plans to add pencil-or-crayon spike obstacles in specific maze sections to increase difficulty.
development_findings.quote: We also gotta add spikes to this area here—I want this to be like spikes that you jump over.

development_findings.summary: Clarified that ROM hacks never truly needed the N64 Expansion Pak; earlier tools just used it for convenience. Optimized code now lets hacks run on real hardware without it.
development_findings.quote: You don't even need my optimized source codes to make a ROM hack run without the expansion pack.

development_findings.summary: Retro section placement debate: pipe originally near wing-cap area; considering moving it to pyramid/bridge zones and using exclamation boxes or rollable bridges for gating.
development_findings.quote: Anything we do with a rollable bridge is weird because you unlock the wing cap anyway.

development_findings.summary: Wants greater use of breakable/exclamation boxes throughout the game for variety and secrets.
development_findings.quote: I think we very much under-utilized exclamation boxes in this game.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 is almost complete; Course 15 is halfway; after that only three side levels and three overworld parts remain. Target: main content done in 2025, then polish.
development_findings.quote: We're almost done with Course 14 and Course 15 is also already halfway done… we’re definitely gonna finish all the main content in 2025.

development_findings.summary: Re-worked courses so far: 1, 3, 4, 5, 6? (typo), and 11; ice castle (Course 15) still needs exterior pass.
development_findings.quote: What's gotten reworked is course one, course three, course four, course five… course 11 for sure.

development_findings.summary: Renamed the ice-castle level to 'Forgotten Fortress' after a brainstorming session on mood-appropriate wording.
development_findings.quote: Forgotten Fortress—that’s what we went with.

development_findings.summary: Abandoned initial idea of a Mario Paint music-staff platformer; instead outlined a Mario Paint canvas minigame where players walk into paint pools, trace an outlined Mario face, ground-pound to fill areas, and are scored via pixel comparison.
development_findings.quote: Outline of Mario… when Mario walks he leaves this paint… once you’ve drawn Mario close enough you’ll get a new star.

development_findings.summary: Technical plan: 124×124 RGBA32 canvas, dotted outline texture, pixel-matching algorithm to evaluate accuracy, color pools (red, black, white, blue, beige, plus green/yellow/purple).
development_findings.quote: 124x124 canvas RGBA32… The further away from matching they are, the higher your score.

development_findings.summary: Extended generic saw object params to include opacity (alpha) via bparam3 bitmask.
development_findings.quote: We could easily do something like… opacity = bparam3 & 0xFC; there you go, it's implemented.

context_findings.summary: Moved from Germany to Canada in 2021; left because he felt German politics were corrupt and unfixable.
context_findings.quote: I moved to Canada because I needed to flee Germany—Germany fucking sucks.

context_findings.summary: Does not vote and shows apathy toward elections, preferring entertainment-style coverage over civic engagement.
context_findings.quote: I have no idea about German politics and I don't care… I want the WWE excitement experience.

context_findings.summary: Received a sponsored offer to stream Roblox for $135; plans a two-hour Roblox session (likely Sunday).
context_findings.quote: $135 for two hours… that’s like almost $70 an hour to play Roblox.

context_findings.summary: Frustrated by an ISP sales scheme: cheaper plan, no contract presented, installer admits service is 'dogshit', causing Zeina’s PC to lose internet.
context_findings.quote: Now we have the router that by their own admittance is dogshit.

context_findings.summary: Recalls discovering pro-wrestling was scripted at a young age; liked Eddie Guerrero.
context_findings.quote: I stopped watching wrestling when I found out it's fake.

biobak.summary: Responsible for final coloring/texturing of the newly UV-mapped Course 14 area.
biobak.quote: He’s gonna make the colors pretty and everything.

biobak.summary: Interactively chats in French, leading Kaze to joke he 'involuntarily learned French'.
biobak.quote: You just made me involuntarily learn French.

zeina.summary: Working on the outside area for the ice castle (Course 15).
zeina.quote: There's still the outside area that Zeina wanted to work on.

zeina.summary: Suggested adding a rollable bridge and engages in light-hearted banter with Kaze.
zeina.quote: He really, really wants the rollable bridge at this point—I'm almost willing to add it just for him.

zeina.summary: Lost PC internet because installer botched new router setup; Kaze plans to revert after stream.
zeina.quote: You have no internet in your PC—the guy fucked it up.

key_stories.title: Routers & Regrets
key_stories.summary: Kaze accepted what seemed like a cheaper internet deal without signing anything. Within 12 hours, a technician installed a new router but admitted the service was poor, leaving Zeina offline.
key_stories.challenge: Attractive price for new ISP with no clear contract.
key_stories.process: Technician installed router; immediately disclosed quality issues.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze plans to remove the router and restore previous connection after stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Our internet is dogshit—I don't use it, I just work for this company.

key_stories.title: Expansion Pak Myth-busting
key_stories.summary: Viewers questioned why some hacks need the N64 Expansion Pak. Kaze explained it was historical laziness and confirmed his optimized code removes the requirement.
key_stories.challenge: Community belief that advanced hacks must use extra RAM.
key_stories.process: Explained memory management history and optimization work.
key_stories.outcome: Clarified Return to Yoshi's Island will run on stock hardware.
key_stories.key_quote: Hacks never needed the expansion pack; the tools were just programmed lazily.

key_stories.title: Mario Paint or Dr. Mario?
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggled to find engaging platforming for Course 14's retro pipe. After brainstorming, he pivoted from Mario Paint's music staff to a canvas-drawing minigame.
key_stories.challenge: Mario Paint lacks obvious 3-D platforming mechanics.
key_stories.process: Considered Dr. Mario pill-fall idea, then devised interactive drawing with paint pools and accuracy scoring.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on Mario Paint canvas minigame with pixel-match evaluation.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe Mario Paint just sucks as a retro section… Outline of Mario, draw him, score by how close you get.

open_questions.context: Kaze outlined a 124×124 pixel canvas, color pools, and accuracy scoring but hasn’t detailed algorithmic approach or player feedback mechanisms.
questions: How will the game communicate progress or scoring to the player while drawing?
What tolerance threshold will determine ‘close enough’ for awarding the star?
Will there be time limits or hazards to keep the section engaging?

open_questions.context: Geometry is being sent to Biobak for coloring; timeline and workflow not specified.
questions: What is the expected turnaround time for Biobak’s texturing pass?
How do Kaze and Biobak iterate on color palettes and thematic cohesion?
Are there performance constraints Biobak must consider while texturing?

open_questions.context: Zeina is responsible but no details on scope or artistic direction were provided.
questions: What visual and gameplay goals does Zeina have for the ice-castle exterior?
How does her animation expertise influence level geometry?
What’s the current schedule for completing Course 15’s exterior?

open_questions.context: Kaze noted audio quality is maxed out and streamed music eats ROM space.
questions: What techniques are being used to balance high-quality streamed music with limited cartridge space?
Could Badub compose adaptive or shorter loops to save memory?
Will the final build require compromises in soundtrack variety?

open_questions.context: Kaze is waiting for cardboard Donkey Kong and Peach models but status unknown.
questions: What role will the cardboard DK and Peach play in the game?
Has Yuki provided any timeline or design drafts?
Are there fallback plans if these assets are delayed?
